description: Handwoven & handprinted with 16\" pomegranite like designs separated by 19\" \"Lazy S\". Vert. rpt. 36\"; horiz. 18.75\". Large Orange, green & gold. Heavy weight silk.Padded and machine quilted to cottom muslin. Vert. Rpt 32.5\". Horiz. Rpt.36\" finished on all four sides. Saffron
text: Pomegranate captured the essence of dramatic and highly valued 19th-century Central Asian ikats (fabrics whose yarns are resist-dyed before weaving), which were beginning to appear in Western art galleries. This pattern was introduced as part of the Afghan collection, along with several textiles that Jack Larsenâ€™s visit to Afghanistan in the early 1970s inspired. Pomegranate was discontinued in 1994.
title: Pomegranate
